page.title: 05LOCAL FARMING
page.content: This is an area of mixed farming.That is to say most farms in the area have livestock and grow crops of roots and cereals. Many more farms used to produce milk than do now. Most of the big milk producers have increased their while the smaller ones have turned to{calf rearing, {beef}production or{ sheep. The main cereal crop is winter{barley though plenty of winter{wheat}and some winter{oats}are grown. These are sown in the autumn and are usually harvested (weather permitting) during the following July and August. A few winter{beans}are grown.These are a good source of protien for animals feeding.It used to be unusual to harvest these before October but these days the stalks and leaves are killed off with spray and this makes it possible to conbine them in late
